Review Text: Spent two nights there and it was just okay. When you book online, remember you may be charged differently on arrival because they calculate using their current dollar rate.  They were kind to upgrade our room as first time visitors. Room was clean and conducive even though the bathroom tap was faulty (informed them but they said they couldn't fix it during our stay) "English breakfast" was super basic (2slices of bread,omelette,sausage &baked beans). It was sad to find that breakfast didn't come with water, just tea and coffee options.  Requested an omelette but the waiter brought a sunny side up and insisted it was an omelette.   Front desk was quite helpful and courteous.   There's a supermarket on site with a wide range of products. Parking is also available, sometimes gets

The swimming pool area is relaxing, and they got an excellent kitchen especially in African cuisine. A good hideaway for someone who likes to keep to himself, also a supermarket in complex which caters to the needs of lodgers which solves a lot of unforeseen problems as i forgot some basic travel things in my first stay there.

Nice place to visit . Safe secure and serene. The new lounge has added aesthetic value to the hotel. Good job to the management. I have been here severally and it is a good place to be. The rooms are clean, good customer service however the bathrooms should be improved on. The restaurant too should improve on the time to deliver food to the rooms. Overall, it is a good place.

Review Title: Perfect Stay at the Parkview Astoria Hotel
Review Text: I came in contact with the Parkview Astoria product recently and discovered it to be a hidden gem in an otherwise rough environment. Lagos is a the most populous City in sub-saharan Africa. If you've travelled in Africa extensively, you know what that means. Simply, you'll be coming in contact with heavy traffic, a sea of human heads in a very disorderly environment which means a general sense of insecurity. Parkview Astoria Hotel is in one of the most serene and secure but close to major commercial hub of the City accommodation facility offered in this part of Africa.  It is in a gated estate on the Island of Ikoyi in an upscale neighborhood. The facilities are quite adequate for a four star facility and the staff are very friendly and helpful. If you want a secure and serene
Room Tips: 3rd floor South east wing accessible to the foyer

Review Text: I needed a place to cool of and spend some time to think and strategize for the upcoming year and Parkview Astoria was an excellent choice. The location is very serene and the hotel facility is luxurious. They have a pool, gym and other awesome amenities also and they made me comfortable. It was a wonderful experience.

Review Title: Business meeting at Parkview Astoria Hotels, Ikoyi.
Review Text: A first time visit to Parkview Astoria Hotels, Parkview Estate, Ikoyi, Lagos was not disappointing at all. When my Public Relations Officer hinted me about the Hotel, I was not too eager to be there at first but on arriving Parkview Astoria Hotels; starting from the reception...i was impressed by the receptionists as they exhibited thorough professionalism. The meeting room was spaciously arranged and perfectly decorated to suit the day`s purpose.  A quick glance at this hotel`s finishing portrays elegance, serenity and splendour. I never wanted to "carry last" and as such I opted to see the rooms, they are beautifully designed I must confess. I look forward to having a nice holiday with my family in this hotel as it is a home away from home with perfect modern amenities. The
Room Tips: Rooms at the higher floors are unique with a unique spacy foyer for external relaxation.

Review Text: Stayed here for a night as the hotel where I had been staying wasn't available for that night. A very ordinary hotel. Medium sized room with an old CCTV. Badly lit. Had a small split AC installed which was leaking profusely, leaving a largish puddle by the morning. The bathroom was wierd. It had an installation of a Jet shower. However, only the tap of the fixture was working, that too providing only a trickle of water. Realised that the fixture had just been put without it being installed. WiFi was provided but was virtually non-functional.  No breakfast spread. Was provided toasted bread and bad tea. The only positives of the hotel are polite staff and its economical rates
